017package org.apache.commons.chain.config;
018
019import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertEquals;
020import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertFalse;
021import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertInstanceOf;
022import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNotNull;
023import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertNull;
024import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertTrue;
025
026import java.util.Iterator;
027
028import org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog;
029import org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory;
030import org.apache.commons.chain.Command;
031import org.apache.commons.chain.Context;
032import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.AddingCommand;
033import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogBase;
034import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ChainBase;
035import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ContextBase;
036import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.DelegatingCommand;
037import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.DelegatingFilter;
038import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ExceptionCommand;
039import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ExceptionFilter;
040import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.NonDelegatingCommand;
041import org.apache.commons.chain.impl.NonDelegatingFilter;
042import org.apache.commons.digester.Digester;
043import org.junit.jupiter.api.AfterEach;
044import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
045import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
046
047/**
048 * Test case identical to {@link ConfigParserTestCase} except
049 * that it uses the {@code define} rule to define aliases
050 * for the commands and chains used in the test.
051 */
052public class ConfigParser2TestCase {
053    private static final String DEFAULT_XML =
054        "/org/apache/commons/chain/config/test-config-2.xml";
055
056    // ------------------------------------------------------ Instance Variables
057
058    /**
059     * The {@code Catalog} to contain our configured commands.
060     */
061    protected Catalog<Context> catalog = null;
062
063    /**
064     * The {@code Context} to use for execution tests.
065     */
066    protected Context context = null;
067
068    /**
069     * The {@code ConfigParser} instance under test.
070     */
071    protected ConfigParser parser = null;
072
073    // ---------------------------------------------------- Overall Test Methods
074
075    /**
076     * Set up instance variables required by this test case.
077     */
078    @BeforeEach
079    public void init() {
080        catalog = new CatalogBase<>();
081        context = new ContextBase();
082        parser = new ConfigParser();
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Tear down instance variables required by this test case.
087     */
088    @AfterEach
089    public void tearDown() {
090        parser = null;
091        context = null;
092        catalog = null;
093    }
094
095    // ------------------------------------------------ Individual Test Methods
096
097    /**
098     * Load the default test-config.xml file and examine the results
099     *
100     * @throws Exception any error
101     */
102    @Test
103    public void testDefaut() throws Exception {
104        // Check overall command count
105        load(DEFAULT_XML);
106        checkCommandCount(17);
107
108        // Check individual single command instances
109        Command<Context> command = null;
110
111        command = catalog.getCommand("AddingCommand");
112        assertNotNull(command);
113        assertInstanceOf(AddingCommand.class, command);
114
115        command = catalog.getCommand("DelegatingCommand");
116        assertNotNull(command);
117        assertInstanceOf(DelegatingCommand.class, command);
118
119        command = catalog.getCommand("DelegatingFilter");
120        assertNotNull(command);
121        assertInstanceOf(DelegatingFilter.class, command);
122
123        command = catalog.getCommand("ExceptionCommand");
124        assertNotNull(command);
125        assertInstanceOf(ExceptionCommand.class, command);
126
127        command = catalog.getCommand("ExceptionFilter");
128        assertNotNull(command);
129        assertInstanceOf(ExceptionFilter.class, command);
130
131        command = catalog.getCommand("NonDelegatingCommand");
132        assertNotNull(command);
133        assertInstanceOf(NonDelegatingCommand.class, command);
134
135        command = catalog.getCommand("NonDelegatingFilter");
136        assertNotNull(command);
137        assertInstanceOf(NonDelegatingFilter.class, command);
138
139        command = catalog.getCommand("ChainBase");
140        assertNotNull(command);
141        assertInstanceOf(ChainBase.class, command);
142        assertInstanceOf(TestChain.class, command);
143
144        // Check configurable properties instance
145        TestCommand tcommand = (TestCommand) catalog.getCommand("Configurable");
146        assertNotNull(tcommand);
147        assertEquals(tcommand.getFoo(), "Foo Value");
148        assertEquals(tcommand.getBar(), "Bar Value");
149    }
150
151    /**
152     * Test execution of chain "Execute2a"
153     *
154     * @throws Exception any error
155     */
156    @Test
157    public void testExecute2a() throws Exception {
158        load(DEFAULT_XML);
159        assertTrue(catalog.getCommand("Execute2a").execute(context),
160                   "Chain returned true");
161        checkExecuteLog("1/2/3");
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * Test execution of chain "Execute2b"
166     *
167     * @throws Exception any error
168     */
169    @Test
170    public void testExecute2b() throws Exception {
171        load(DEFAULT_XML);
172        assertFalse(catalog.getCommand("Execute2b").execute(context),
173                    "Chain returned false");
174        checkExecuteLog("1/2/3");
175    }
176
177    /**
178     * Test execution of chain "Execute2c"
179     *
180     * @throws Exception any error
181     */
182    @Test
183    public void testExecute2c() throws Exception {
184        load(DEFAULT_XML);
185        try {
186            catalog.getCommand("Execute2c").execute(context);
187        } catch (ArithmeticException e) {
188            assertEquals("3", e.getMessage(),
189                         "Correct exception id");
190        }
191        checkExecuteLog("1/2/3");
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Test execution of chain "Execute2d"
196     *
197     * @throws Exception any error
198     */
199    @Test
200    public void testExecute2d() throws Exception {
201        load(DEFAULT_XML);
202        try {
203            catalog.getCommand("Execute2d").execute(context);
204        } catch (ArithmeticException e) {
205            assertEquals("2", e.getMessage(),
206                         "Correct exception id");
207        }
208        checkExecuteLog("1/2");
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Test execution of chain "Execute4a"
213     *
214     * @throws Exception any error
215     */
216    @Test
217    public void testExecute4a() throws Exception {
218        load(DEFAULT_XML);
219        assertTrue(catalog.getCommand("Execute4a").execute(context),
220                   "Chain returned true");
221        checkExecuteLog("1/2/3/c/a");
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Test execution of chain "Execute2b"
226     *
227     * @throws Exception any error
228     */
229    @Test
230    public void testExecute4b() throws Exception {
231        load(DEFAULT_XML);
232        assertFalse(catalog.getCommand("Execute4b").execute(context),
233                    "Chain returned false");
234        checkExecuteLog("1/2/3/b");
235    }
236
237    /**
238     * Test execution of chain "Execute4c"
239     *
240     * @throws Exception any error
241     */
242    @Test
243    public void testExecute4c() throws Exception {
244        load(DEFAULT_XML);
245        try {
246            catalog.getCommand("Execute4c").execute(context);
247        } catch (ArithmeticException e) {
248            assertEquals("3", e.getMessage(),
249                         "Correct exception id");
250        }
251        checkExecuteLog("1/2/3/c/b/a");
252    }
253
254    /**
255     * Test execution of chain "Execute4d"
256     *
257     * @throws Exception any error
258     */
259    @Test
260    public void testExecute4d() throws Exception {
261        load(DEFAULT_XML);
262        try {
263            catalog.getCommand("Execute4d").execute(context);
264        } catch (ArithmeticException e) {
265            assertEquals("2", e.getMessage(),
266                         "Correct exception id");
267        }
268        checkExecuteLog("1/2/b/a");
269    }
270
271    /**
272     * Test a pristine ConfigParser instance
273     */
274    @Test
275    public void testPristine() {
276        // Validate the "digester" property
277        Digester digester = parser.getDigester();
278        assertNotNull(digester, "Returned a Digester instance");
279        assertFalse(digester.getNamespaceAware(),
280                    "Default namespaceAware");
281        assertTrue(digester.getUseContextClassLoader(),
282                   "Default useContextClassLoader");
283        assertFalse(digester.getValidating(),
284                   "Default validating");
285
286        // Validate the "ruleSet" property
287        ConfigRuleSet ruleSet = (ConfigRuleSet) parser.getRuleSet();
288        assertNotNull(ruleSet, "Returned a RuleSet instance");
289        assertEquals("chain", ruleSet.getChainElement(),
290                     "Default chainElement");
291        assertEquals("className", ruleSet.getClassAttribute(),
292                     "Default classAttribute");
293        assertEquals("command", ruleSet.getCommandElement(),
294                     "Default commandElement");
295        assertEquals("name", ruleSet.getNameAttribute(),
296                     "Default nameAttribute");
297        assertNull(ruleSet.getNamespaceURI(),
298                   "Default namespaceURI");
299
300        // Validate the "useContextClassLoader" property
301        assertTrue(parser.getUseContextClassLoader(),
302                   "Defaults to use context class loader");
303
304        // Ensure that there are no preconfigured commands in the catalog
305        checkCommandCount(0);
306    }
307
308    // --------------------------------------------------------- Private Methods
309
310    /**
311     * Verify the number of configured commands
312     *
313     * @param expected the expected value
314     */
315    protected void checkCommandCount(int expected) {
316        int n = 0;
317        Iterator<String> names = catalog.getNames();
318        while (names.hasNext()) {
319            String name = names.next();
320            n++;
321            assertNotNull(catalog.getCommand(name), name + " exists");
322        }
323        assertEquals(expected, n, "Correct command count");
324    }
325
326    /**
327     * Verify the contents of the execution log
328     *
329     * @param expected the expected value
330     */
331    protected void checkExecuteLog(String expected) {
332        StringBuffer log = (StringBuffer) context.get("log");
333        assertNotNull(log, "Context returned log");
334        assertEquals(expected, log.toString(),
335                     "Context returned correct log");
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Load the specified catalog from the specified resource path
340     *
341     * @param path resource path to load specified catalog
342     *
343     * @throws Exception any error
344     */
345    protected void load(String path) throws Exception {
346        CatalogFactory.clear();
347        parser.parse(this.getClass().getResource(path));
348        catalog = CatalogFactory.getInstance().getCatalog("foo");
349    }
350}
